4 Right Exertions

“There is the case where a monk generates desire, endeavors, activates persistence, upholds & exerts his intent

  1. for the sake of the non-arising of evil, unskillful dhammas that have not yet arisen
  2. for the sake of the abandoning of evil, unskillful dhammas that have arisen
  3. for the sake of the arising of skillful dhammas that have not yet ariseen
  4. for the maintenance, non-confusion, increase, plenitude, development, & culmination of skillful dhammas that have arisen.”

— SN 45:8

¶

“One tries to abandon wrong view & to enter into right view:

This is one's right effort…

“One tries to abandon wrong resolve & to enter into right resolve:

This is one's right effort…

“One tries to abandon wrong speech & to enter into right speech:

This is one's right effort…

“One tries to abandon wrong action & to enter into right action:

This is one's right effort…

“One tries to abandon wrong livelihood & to enter into right livelihood:

This is one's right effort.”

— MN 117
